cookingMethod: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, and red chili powder.
Add chicken pieces to the bowl and mix well. Marinate for 1 hour.
In a large pan, heat oil and butter. Add onions and fry until golden brown.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Add marinated chicken and cook until the chicken is tender, about 20-25 minutes.
Add garam masala and salt, and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add cream and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and saute until golden brown.
Add ginger and garlic paste and saute for 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add chopped spinach and cook until it wilts.
Add all the spices and salt and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add cubed paneer and mix well.
Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and saute until golden brown.
Add ginger and garlic paste and saute for 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add all the spices and salt and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add soaked chickpeas and mix well.
Add enough water to cover the chickpeas and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the chickpeas are tender.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

ingredients: 500g boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the chicken and yogurt. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
Add the garam masala, paprika, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne pepper and cook for another minute.
Add the chicken and yogurt mixture and cook until the chicken is browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the heavy cream and cilantro and cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice or naan bread.
Soak the basmati rice in water for 30 minutes.
Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee in a pan and add the sliced onions. Fry until they turn golden brown.
Remove the onions from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add the remaining ghee and the whole spices (green cardamom pods, cloves, bay leaves, and cinnamon sticks). Fry until fragrant.
Add the chopped tomatoes and fry until they turn mushy.
Add the ginger garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Fry for a minute.
Add the chicken pieces and fry until they turn brown.
Add the yogurt and mix well.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked.
In a separate pot, add the soaked basmati rice and 2 cups of water. Cook until the rice is almost done.
Drain any excess water from the rice.
In a large pot, spread a layer of rice at the bottom.
Add a layer of chicken on top of the rice.
Add a layer of fried onions on top of the chicken.
Repeat the layers of rice, chicken, and fried onions until all the ingredients are used up.
Cover the pot with a lid and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Prick the eggplant with a fork in several places and place it on a baking sheet.
Bake the eggplant in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes or until it is completely soft and the skin is charred.
Once done, remove from the oven and allow it to cool down.
Peel off the charred skin and mash the pulp well with a fork or masher.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell goes away.
Add chopped tomato and green chilies and cook until the tomato is soft and mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala and mix well.
Add the mashed eggplant and mix everything well.
Add salt to taste and cook for a few more minutes until the eggplant is heated through.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.
